jobs.description:
### Overview

At [Netlify](https://www.netlify.com), we’re building a platform to empower digital designers and developers to build better, more elaborate web projects than ever before. We’re aiming to change the landscape of modern web development.

The fullstack engineer's mission is to build the APIs and user interfaces that thousands of developers use when they deploy their sites on Netlify.


### Some of the challenges you’ll be working on

- Build new features to make working with Netlify a fantastic experience for developers.
- Build internal tools to help our other teams interact with our users.
- Integrate our [Open Source](/open-source) projects with the rest of Netlify's platform.
- Make using our CLI a delightful experience for new and experienced users.


### To be effective in this role, you’ll benefit from experience in:

- Scripting programming languages. We use Ruby, with Rails as web framework, and JavaScript.
- Writing web applications with a decoupled JavaScript frontend.
- UI and UX experience.
- Web and CDN technologies.
- Internet standards like HTTP, DNS, and TLS.


### Competencies that we value in candidates

- You enjoy helping and mentoring other engineers to grow.
- You can focus on key priorities and pragmatic solutions.
- You can adjust quickly to changing priorities and conditions.
- You are curious about compiled programming languages. We use Go and C++ in some areas of our infrastructure.


### About the Team

Though the team is small, we are a fast-growing startup. You will be working across the company. There are only less than twenty of us, so you are getting in at a time when we need people who can help us build a path towards the future.

We believe that empowered, engaged employees do the best work. We’ll be giving you the tools you need to succeed and looking to you for suggestions for improvement not just in your daily job, but in many other aspects of building a company. Whether you work from our main office in San Francisco, or you are a remote employee, we’ll be working together a lot - particularly, pairing and collaborating - we want you to succeed!  We don’t want you to work too hard (burnout is real), and we do want to encourage you to grow ([impostor syndrome](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Impostor_syndrome) is also real) - and we’ll help you do that.

Netlify is devoted to building a team of people with different backgrounds and lifestyles. We eagerly invite applications from people of all kinds. We don’t discriminate against employees or applicants based on gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, religion, age, race, citizenship, pregnancy status, or any other differences. If we can do anything to provide a better interview, i.e. accommodate a disability, then please do let us know.


### How we hire

Our hiring process starts as soon as you email us at [careers@netlify.com](mailto:careers@netlify.com). Please send us a thoughtful cover letter explaining why you enjoy building APIs and microservices, and why you’d like to work at Netlify.

After we evaluate this email, we will schedule a conference call so we can meet. If you live in San Francisco, we usually substitute this call with a visit to our office. This first meeting helps us to learn more about your past experience and helps you to learn a little bit more about our company and how we work.

If we move forward with the process, we will work together in designing a test to evaluate your technical skills. We’ll invite you to join a dedicated Slack channel where we can reach each other and talk about the test.

If the test is successful, we'll schedule a next meeting with other members of the company that you’ll be working with, directly or indirectly.

After this third interview, you’ll meet with the management team to discuss salary and other compensations.

jobs.description:
Join our product team to play a crucial role in the development of our platform. Shape the user experience of a product that has immense impact, every day...

You’ll work with a small, experienced team. Our product is still young so there is plenty of room to introduce technologies, tools and processes. On the other hand, we have incredible domain knowledge in-house, a growing base of customers for rapid feedback and financial backing from some great experts in the education industry.

 

###ABOUT US

[Pobble](https://pobble.com) is an award winning edtech start-up, founded by teachers. We believe that a spark of inspiration can change a child’s trajectory. After an initial 2 years on the previous build, we relaunched in September 2015 and are now seeing rapid growth.

Today, primary school teachers use Pobble to find teaching resources, collaborate with classes across the world, and give pupils a real audience for their writing. In short, Pobble makes writing ridiculously exciting!

We work with hundreds of schools and reach tens of thousands of pupils every week. And we’re just getting started: we are growing fast in the UK and internationally, and are creating the product to make that possible.

 

### ABOUT YOU

We can't wait to see your work. How have you impacted the success of the previous products you've worked on? Here is what's important to us (and we hope also to you):

- Experience with our stack (React, Angular, ES6, Webpack, Gulp, REST)
- Agile methodologies (we stand-up every day and constantly groom our backlog)
- Data and metrics (test, learn and implement – rinse and repeat)
- Eager to try stuff (if it doesn’t work: fine, learn from it and try again)
- Team play (share your experience to make the team better)
- An open team atmosphere (code reviews, open discussion and always beer in stock)

 

### COMPENSATION DETAILS

You’ll receive £55-65k base salary depending on experience. Additionally, all our team members have the opportunity to own a part of our business as part of our option scheme. On top of that we offer:

- Work with a great [team](https://pobble.com/join-us) of passionate and talented individuals;
- A fantastic office environment in the heart of Primrose Hill, London (Utopia Village);
- 10 minutes walk from Camden Town tube;
- Freedom to work flexible hours in line with the needs of your job, and partly remote;
- A budget for training and development.

 

### AND NOW...

If this sounds good, don’t wait a second longer and [get in touch](https://www.pobble.com/join-us#op-181943-frontend-engineer). We’ll get back to you soon!

jobs.description:
Booking.com BV (the company behind Booking.com™, the market leading online accommodation reservation service in the world) is looking for the world’s smartest designers. Join the world’s leading accommodation company and help define the future of travel. This position offers the successful candidate the freedom to make meaningful and measurable improvements, impacting millions of people. You’ll join us at our beautiful Amsterdam HQ and work with some of our industry’s smartest people.


**B.responsible**

As a UX Designer you’ll be a key part of the idea generation process, working in a small startup-like group which takes full ownership of their part of our platform. ‘Designer’ is just what it says on your CV – you’d be just as happy to be labeled an Engineer, or Analyst; a Builder, Maker or Problem Solver. Your portfolio is a collection of stories that you can discuss with enthusiasm, and regret … because you’re always getting better at what you do and you’re never satisfied with ‘good enough’. You’re excited about the endless potential of the web and being able to build things that millions of people can use every day.

 

**B.skilled**

As a candidate for the UX Designer position, you possess a broad range of abilities:

You are comfortable with each part of the design process, from research to exceptional UI design, through to shipping production code
You are proficient with HTML & CSS
You have experience with template engines to display data from the backend – you’d be implementing your work using our in-house templating engine (don’t worry - we’ll show you the ropes!)
You are comfortable creating the wireframes, polished mockups, and prototypes needed to communicate them (e.g., Sketch, Framer, InVision)
Your strengths include being self-driven and taking full ownership of your ideas to solve challenging problems
You are comfortable working collaboratively with developers, product owners, and copywriters
You thrive on feedback and critique, responding with creative thinking and iterative design
You are a passionate advocate for the user, dedicated to the craft of design and creating elegant user experiences
You understand and thrive in an environment which employs extensive A/B testing - Booking.com is a data-informed company
 

**B. Experienced**

We’re looking for Designers with a minimum of 4 years of relevant experience, ideally with some history of working in e-commerce & data-informed organisations.

Designers at Booking.com must be excellent collaborators – we work in an agile, dynamic, diverse environment in which openness & humility are key. Our designers combine their knowledge and expertise with the goals of our business to deliver a world-class user experience to our diverse, loyal user-base. At Booking.com, design is a team sport, and together we solve hard problems while keeping the user at the center of everything we do.

Ensuring a diverse and inclusive workplace is part of our core values. We are an equal opportunity employer and know that a team of different backgrounds, abilities, and perspectives makes us thrive and build better products. We are fortunate to be members of one of the most diverse design teams in the world and we do our best work when we join forces. We’re looking forward to welcoming you into our team of exceptionally talented and fun colleagues, where you'll do challenging and rewarding work.

You will also contribute to the growth of Booking.com through interviewing, on-boarding, or other recruitment efforts

 

**B.offered**

We are a performance-based company that offers career advancement and lucrative compensation, including bonuses and stock potential.  We also offer what we call the “Booking Deal” with other competitive perks and benefits.  IT also has regular hackathons, training and attends/speaks at global conferences.

This position is open to worldwide candidates and in the case of relocation, we will assist you with a generous relocation package, ensuring a smooth transition to working and living in Amsterdam.  We have successfully relocated 200+ IT professionals to Amsterdam in the last year!


**Interested?**

Please send your CV and portfolio to **jorrit.devries@booking.com**.

# TweetDeck is hiring!

Hi, my name's [Amy][5] and I'm a frontend engineer with [TweetDeck][4] in London. We're currently on the lookout for both mid and senior frontend engineers to join our team.

## The unofficial job description

Yes, you'll be working with legacy code. TweetDeck has been around for a little while now. And no, we're not (yet) using React. 

For the most part we use a framework called [Flight.js][2], which feels surprisingly similar to React. React is our end goal, and we're close, but we want to eradicate some of our legacy components first. 

I personally find the codebase really exciting. Tweets in columns sounds simple, right? But there is a whole world of complexity and logic to it. You'll constantly stumble into parts of the codebase that you never knew existed. There will always be something new to learn. 

You'll also be joining TweetDeck at a really exciting time, both technically and for our users. We're currently exploring some brand new, greenfield projects, which will mean building lots of cool new features. 

Most importantly, you'll be joining an incredibly lovely and talented team. You'll be working closely with design, product management and TweetDeck's backend engineers. See my mentor and tech lead Andreas's [Moment][3] for more insight. 

## The [official job description][1]

It's a little jam-packed, so please don't let it scare you off. Also note that this description is for a senior candidate. The description for mids is not yet available, but mids are still encouraged to apply. 

Oh, and don't feel like you must have a Computer Science degree. We are open to people from both CS and non-CS backgrounds. Our code tests are real world and practical, and require the kind of problem solving that you will use on the job.

## To apply

Shoot me an email (asimmons@twitter.com) with your resume or LinkedIn, or apply via the Twitter London careers page. 

[1]: https://careers.twitter.com/en/work-for-twitter/senior-front-end-engineer-tweetdeck-london.html
[2]: https://flightjs.github.io/
[3]: https://twitter.com/i/moments/826789348901269504
[4]: https://tweetdeck.twitter.com/
[5]: https://twitter.com/amesimmons

If you have a passion for HTML and CSS, we want you at DockYard!
 
DockYard is a software consultancy based in Boston (with remote employees) that specializes in web applications. We have in-house designers, developers, and project managers, and we are looking for a Senior HTML/CSS Developer to join our growing team. You’ll work alongside talented individuals on groundbreaking projects for the world’s largest companies.
 
Our workflow involves three steps. Designers hand off mockups to the HTML/CSS developers who then give styled templates to engineers. Traditionally writing HTML and CSS was the responsibility of designers or engineers, but with the rapid growth of HTML5 and CSS3, we believe that there needs to be a role within the team solely focused on those technologies.
 
As an HTML & CSS developer at DockYard you will collaborate closely with our in-house Design and Engineering teams to facilitate the handoff between visual design and implementation. In addition to that, you will be challenged with helping drive the creation of web applications and solving interesting problems regarding accessibility, browser compatibility, standards compliance, and responsive design.
 
## Responsibilities
 
Lead the HTML & CSS development and architecture of modern web applications, operating between Design and Engineering teams, using industry best practices.
Assist in scoping, estimating, and planning for projects, in collaboration with the team lead.
Act as a mentor to others, guiding and influencing peers through work review, pairing, or other forms of knowledge sharing.
Identify and go after industry developments and business opportunities.

## Must Haves
 
* Advanced knowledge of HTML5 and CSS3
* Experience with BEM and SMACSS
* Experience with Sketch and/or Photoshop
* Excellent communication skills

## Nice to Haves

* Knowledge of PostCSS
* Prior client services, consulting, or freelancing experience
* Experience working in a remote team

## Level

Senior

## Employment Type

Full-time, remote (U.S. only)

## Apply

Please send an email to careers@dockyard.com with your contact information, a bit of background about yourself, and the reason why you are applying.

At DockYard, we value diversity and strongly encourage candidates from all backgrounds to apply.

## Who we are

[N26](https://n26.com) aims at being Europe’s first Mobile Bank. We want the banking experience to be simple, fast and contemporary with a strong focus on the user. This is why design and technology empower everything we do.

Our offices in the center of Berlin are where the 200 of us work to provide Europe a fantastic banking experience.

## Who you are

We’ll be entirely honest, we don’t have an overly specific profile in mind.

We are simply looking for good software developers who care about building a good product. So if you want to work on an ambitious web platform supporting N26, powered by a robust yet recent tech stack shaped with fresh design, maybe we would be a good fit for you!

Regarding skills & qualifications, you should obviously know a good deal of HTML, CSS and JavaScript. You should be able (and willing) to work in a fast and efficient agile framework. And finally you should care about accessibility, performance and user experience. We would say almost everything else, such as knowledge in React and GraphQL is a plus.

## What you will do

Working here, you will join our cross-disciplinary teams to work on N26 projects, such as the new website, the revamping of the web application, or the registration process. Our entire tech stack is unified across all web projects so the learning curve from one project to the other is practically non existant.

If you would like to know more about the said tech stack, you’ll be pleased to know we build and maintain a universal React application, fed with GraphQL, styled with Fela and covered with extensive tests (routes, accessibility,  end-to-end…). Nothing but the good!

## How to apply

Get in touch with [@HugoGiraudel](https://twitter.com/HugoGiraudel) on Twitter, or apply directly from the [official offer on N26.com](https://n26.com/jobs/126939/?gh_jid=126939). We’re excited to welcome you!

G&A specializes in site specific interactive experiences. We are interested in using web technologies for traditional purposes (i.e. informational kiosks, micro sites), as well as challenging purposes such as locally distributed gaming mechanisms, WebGL realtime rendering, animations, and spatial exploration tools. The Contract Front Developer should be able to take ownership of project tasks and seamlessly execute alongside the rest of the development team. 

 

You will work in collaboratively with internal design teams and with clients including renowned museums, corporations, universities and governmental organizations.  Our projects range from traveling exhibits, to corporate centers, to large scale museums. 

 

Responsibilities

  • Report to development team-lead about tasks, schedules, and status.

  • Work independently and take ownership of tasks delegated by the team lead.

  • Take ownership of bug fixing and visual troubleshooting.

  • Pixel perfect design implementation.

  • If possible, work in-office for periods where collaboration is advantageous.

 

Qualifications

  • Degree in Computer Science, or equivalent experience; advanced degree a plus.

  • Minimum 4+ years developing cutting edge web experiences.

  • Experience working in an agile or iterative fashion.

  • Expert knowledge of modern web stacks and WebAPIs (Javascript, React, NodeJS, SASS,, Relational, REST APIs, WebSockets, WebRTC, WebGL, D3, etc).

  • Working knowledge of backend technologies.

  • Experience with long-running websites or installations.

  • Experience working with GIT.

  • Experience working with a ticketing system such as Jira.

  • Experience working in an agency environment.

  • Github portfolio with past work experience and personal projects

 

Gallagher & Associates is a global award winning, full service museum exhibition design firm, specializing in design and development of interpretive 3D experiences and interactive media installations. We believe that the hallmark of any exhibit is storytelling and lies in its ability to capture a visitor’s imagination through sights, sounds and words. Constant collaboration between disciplines and with our clients is the foundation of our creative process. Gallagher & Associates’ collaborative working style facilitates the process that is required to develop a storyline that provides a rich, layered learning experience.

 

To Apply

 

Please submit a resume and a GitHub link to technology@gallagherdesign.com.

 

Ideal candidates are located within the tri-state area and have the ability to work in Manhattan for short periods of time.  Remote development is possible for strong candidates when the project allows.

jobs.description:
The Creative Developer will help guide the interaction and creative development of web applications and interfaces with a significant focus on user experiences and dynamic storytelling. Working with a team of designers, editors, product owners and developers, this position will be involved in all phases of digital projects, products and stories. The ideal candidate will have an exceptional portfolio demonstrating user innovations, particularly for mobile devices. 

Responsibilities
Write elegant front-end code for highly-visual, interactive, experiences. 
Work with design, product and technology teams to create editorial tools that push the boundaries of digital storytelling. 
Create a library of interactive components that can be easily utilized by the newsroom and editorial teams. 
Create high-level storyboards, wireframes and prototypes that effectively communicate interaction and design ideas.
Collaborate on best practices for developing interactive experiences with map, graphic and technology teams. Develop documentation, maintain code libraries and style guides. 
Conduct research on industry and technology trends, and continually innovate on digital products that align with National Geographic’s brand standards.

Qualifications
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in Graphic Design, UX or HCI 
Exceptional written and verbal communication skills
Proficiency with JavaScript, HTML and CSS; working knowledge of HTML5, CSS3; responsive design
AT least 2 years of experience with data visualization, frameworks and data libraries is a plus
Experience with video, audio and photography is preferred

National Geographic Partners LLC, a joint venture between National Geographic Society and 21st Century Fox, combines National Geographic television channels with National Geographic’s media and consumer-oriented assets, including National Geographic magazines; National Geographic Studios; related digital and social media platforms; books; maps; children’s media; and ancillary activities that include travel, location-based entertainment, archival sales, catalog, licensing and e-commerce businesses. A portion of the proceeds from National Geographic Partners LLC will be used to fund science, exploration, conservation and education through significant ongoing contributions to the work of the National Geographic Society.
